cleaned_text: How Stress Affects Your Immune System and How Chiropractic Can Help Life is full of challenges and all of us experience stress at times. If you lead a highly stressful life, your body is suffering internally in ways that you may be unaware of. Stress negatively affects your immune system, leading to various mental and physical health complications. However, there's good news. You can opt for chiropractic care to help combat your stress and rebuild your body's natural immunity. How Does Stress Impact Your Immune System? Your immune system protects your body against bacteria, viruses, and anything that may be harmful to you. B cells and T cells are the main white blood cells that help produce antibodies and destroy infected cells. When you're stressed out, [your body produces corticosteroids](https://www.niaid.nih.gov/research/immune-system-overview). This hormone reduces the number of B and T cells in the bloodstream. With fewer cells fighting to keep your body safe, your immune system's efficacy decreases, and you become more susceptible to infections and other diseases. Stress can also impact your immunity indirectly. Many people turn to unhealthy habits such as eating foods high in sugar or drinking alcohol to help them cope with stress.
